p: Adenovirus is another common viral cause of ARI. Adenoviruses are classified into seven species, A to G, and different serotypes have been implicated in different clinical syndromes [ 32]. While the majority of adenovirus infections present as a mild URI, adenovirus is also known to cause LRI including pneumonia, bronchiolitis and bronchitis [ 32, 33]. Adenoviruses can also cause gastrointestinal, ophthalmologic, genitourinary and neurological infections. Adenovirus infections are most common during infancy and early childhood and is prevalent in up to 17% of children hospitalized with ARI [ 32]. Adenovirus is often associated episodes of recurrent wheezing, fever, hypoxia and lengthy hospitalizations [ 32].
